summary: When a new TypeScript SDK project is run without a local Temporal instance, users receive a cryptic [TransportError: transport error] message instead of helpful guidance. The request is for a more informative error message that explains what went wrong.
userImpact: New users get a cryptic error message that doesn't explain why their worker failed to start, making it difficult to troubleshoot connection issues.
rootCause: When Core cannot connect to a Temporal server, it propagates a generic TransportError that lacks context about the actual problem.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved by implementing connection retry logic with warnings instead of immediate failure, as noted in issue #290.
keyQuote: Not relevant anymore since we will log a warning and retry when Core cannot connect (#290)
